channel.title: Morning Mail
channel.description: Stay updated on the latest news and events happening in the RPI community.

item.title: Mantra Health - New Health and Wellness Resource
item.description: To supplement on-campus resources, RPI has partnered with Mantra Health to bring you free, school-sponsored virtual mental health supports.
item.author: Students

item.title: Goldman Sachs Virtual Info Session hosted by SWE | July 23
item.description: Date: Wednesday, July 23, 2025 6:00 PM - 7:00 PM - SWE will be hosting an info session with Goldman Sachs on Wednesday, July 23 beginning at 6pm in Mueller Center room 2104.
item.author: Students

item.title: River Tubing | July 23
item.description: Date: Wednesday, July 23, 2025 10:00 AM - 3:00 PM - Please visit recwell.rpi.edu or reach out to bradbj@rpi.edu for more information.
item.author: Community

item.title: ECSE Hosts a Tour of Nanotech Complex with Prof. Muhsin Celik | July 23 (Registration Required)
item.description: Date: Wednesday, July 23, 2025 12:30 PM - 4:30 PM - Join us for a trip to the Albany Nanotech Complex on July 23rd! We will depart on the bus from the Union Horseshoe at 12:30 PM, and return to campus around 4:30 PM. Register at the event URL by 7/7 to be able to attend - all majors are welcome!
item.author: Community

item.title: Fidelity Confidential Consultation (By Phone with Zoom Video Option) | July 24
item.description: Date: Thursday, July 24, 2025 8:00 AM - 4:30 PM - Schedule a confidential consultation to help you become better informed and more confident about your workplace retirement savings plan benefits. To schedule an appointment, call 1-800-642-7131, Monday through Friday, 8:00 am to midnight, or online at https://nb.fidelity.com/public/nbpreloginnav/rpi/microsite/#/tem/meet-with-us
item.author: Faculty and Staff

item.title: Division of Human Resources Professional Development Workshop: “Leading from Anywhere”
item.description:
At Rensselaer, we maintain that “leadership” involves a learnable set of actions and behaviors that is available to everyone. Whether it be leading a particular project or initiative, assisting others in overcoming obstacles and capitalizing on opportunities, or catalyzing co-creation with colleagues. In this workshop, participants will explore the tenants that comprise everyday leadership and discuss the behaviors that define leadership not as positional or based on title, but rather on values.

For information about sharing your news or events, or to change your subscription settings, visit morningmail.rpi.edu.
item.author: Faculty and Staff
